subject: Gardening
title: Rewilding Your Garden
description: A quick win: understand Rewilding Your Garden.

hook.text: Letting part of your garden grow wild isn't neglect. It's the most powerful ecological action a gardener can take.

buildup.text: Rewilded patches provide food and shelter for pollinators, predatory insects, birds, and small mammals.

discovery.text: A study found that leaving just 10% of a garden unmown increased bee species by 30% within one growing season.

twist.text: Wild patches also support pest predators that spill over into cultivated areas, reducing pest damage in your crops.

climax.text: Rewilding a corner of your garden creates an ecological engine that powers the health of the entire space.

punchline.text: Leave 10% wild. The whole garden benefits.

quiz.question: What effect did leaving 10% of a garden unmown have on bee species?
options: Bee species decreased because wild areas attracted parasites
Bee species increased by 30% within one growing season
No measurable change was observed in pollinator populations
